title: Executive Assistant, Amazon Web Services, Northern Europe
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a proactive, customer obsessed and team oriented Executive Assistant to support the Managing Director and the Technical Director of AWS Europe North. This role requires attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to meet tight deadlines. The candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, fluid environment, while maintaining great flexibility, a sense of humor and composure. The candidate will work autonomously on many projects as required and possess the ability to complete a high volume of tasks with minimal guidance or supervision.  

  

Amazon EAs are the primary point of contact and information flow to and from a variety of teams, clients and partners to our senior leaders - we seek to hire and then offer continual development to the very best EAs ready to work in our fast paced, customer focused organization.  

  

We are looking for bright and motivated candidates with experience of supporting multiple executives and who can demonstrate expertise with complex diary management, travel arrangements and expense recording as well as the set-up, budgeting and active management of small to mid-scale events for their teams.  

  

Superior attention to detail and the ability to meet tight deadlines and juggle multiple requests is critical. Integrity and discretion in handling confidential information and professionalism in dealing with senior executives is imperative. A flexible approach is a must, and the ability to change direction at a moment’s notice.  

  

As a community, the EAs work together to deliver large scale events and to share workload when priorities demand additional support - commitment to teamwork is essential.

title: Data Center Technician Trainee, Data Center Operations, Data Center Operations
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for a Trainee Data Center Technician to join our Rack Decommissioning team as part of our Work Based Learning Program (WBLP).  

As a trainee, you will participate in our 3 months work and training program. This position will help ensure overall availability and reliability for our customers within our Data Centers in Sweden.

* Repairing and diagnosing broken servers

* Has taken STEM or vocational course curriculum

We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: System Architect
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Join our newly established unit Engineering Services and Experience as a System Architect!  

As a System Architect, you will be part of the Engineering Environment Radio Interface Traffic Tool Simulation area. You will drive and participate in architecture solutions through studies and support designers throughout the development process. Together with peer architects and product development teams, you will manage the development program's technical roadmap by aligning it with user needs. Collaboration across Engineering Units will be key to secure that our simulator portfolio is evolving in the right way.  

Engineering Services and Experience (ESE) is within the RAN Software & Compute Platforms Engineering unit (RCE). Its primary goal is to enhance Developer Experience and drive technology evolution and optimization of the engineering environment flows for open and cloud-native RAN software development.  

Are you curious, courageous, and up for the challenge?

 **What you will do:**

* Drive and participate in technical studies
* Manage program technical roadmap evolving simulation portfolio landscape with new test tool concepts that are business case anchored
* Chair relevant technical forums
* Drive synergies and establishing best practice knowledge management, sharing, and re-use
* Deliver results in order to meet stakeholder expectations
* Bring high energy and use your excellent leadership skills to make things happen

 **The skills you bring:**

* > 3 years of Engineering Environment Technical Leadership
* Continuous exploration and ideation to further improve the engineering environment test simulation tool landscape
* Engaging in a partnership culture, ways of working and environment where employees are engaged, demonstrating proactivity, strong performance, high professional ethics, and high energy
* Good understanding of Radio architecture and test scenarios
* Can do attitude with a good ability to adapt and respond to change
* Solid skills in negotiations, communication, mentoring, and ability to motivate and encourage people
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

 **What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 **Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Linköping, Stockholm

**Req ID:** 766569

title: Products Director
description:
We are in search of a dynamic and visionary professional to take on the role of Head of Products. This key position requires a strategic leader who can drive the innovation, development, and lifecycle management of our client's product portfolio. The successful candidate will leverage analytical skills, market insights, and leadership experience to position the company at the forefront of the IT solutions market.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* Define and implement product strategies aligned with company goals and market demands.
* Lead the entire product lifecycle from concept through to launch and post-launch evaluation.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure product alignment with client needs and market trends.
* Drive market analysis and competitive research to make informed decisions.
* Manage and mentor a high-performing team of product managers and designers.
* Ensure continuous improvement and innovation in the product development process.

#### **Product Management and Strategy**

* Develop and articulate a clear product vision and roadmap.
* Evaluate and prioritise product opportunities based on market demand, technology trends, and business potential.
* Ensure product offerings are competitive and meet customer needs efficiently.

##### **Qualifications**

* A minimum of 7 years of experience in product management, preferably in the IT sector.
* Proven track record in leading product teams and managing a product portfolio.
* Strong understanding of IT solutions, cloud services, and innovation in technology.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and strategic planning skills.

###### **Personal Attributes**

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, adept at collaboration across diverse teams.
* Proactive and self-motivated, able to work independently and drive project momentum.
* Adaptable and resilient in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


At Jadeer, we value diversity and equal opportunity. We invite applications from all backgrounds and experiences. If you are passionate about leading products that shape the future of IT solutions, we would like to hear from you.

title: Senior Cloud & FinOps Engineer
description:
- **Är du en duktig molningenjör med passion för både tekniska lösningar och kostnadsoptimering? Vill du arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan molntjänster och ekonomi? Då kan Devoteam M Cloud vara platsen för dig!**  

  

Är du redo att rulla upp skjortärmarna och delta i äventyret?
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  

  

**Devoteam** är ett ledande internationellt konsultföretag som arbetar med digitala transformationer. Vi har över 10 000 kollegor i 20 länder.
  

  

Vi på **Devoteam M Cloud** är specialiserade på Microsoft Azure och blev bland annat utsedda till Partner of the Year (Norge) av Microsoft 2023. Vi söker nu fler duktiga kollegor som vill vara med och skapa fantastiska molnresor för våra kunder. Hos oss möter du en miljö som inte bara handlar om teknisk innovation, utan också om att ha roligt på jobbet! Våra medarbetare brinner för att leverera de bästa lösningarna inom Azure, optimering och modernisering.

  
**Ansvar**

* Automatisera molntjänster och kostnadsoptimering: Skapa säkra och skalbara lösningar som ger fullständig insyn i kostnaderna med verktyg som PowerBI och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Spela en nyckelroll i kundens FinOps-resa: Du kommer att hjälpa våra kunder att förstå och förbättra sina molnkostnader, vilket säkerställer att deras investeringar ger maximalt värde
* Arbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team: Tillsammans med kunden, våra tekniker och utvecklare kommer du att leverera holistiska, smarta lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.

  
**Kvalifikationer**

* Praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba med Infrastruktur som kod (IaC)
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet med molntjänster (Azure, AWS og Google Cloud)
* Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att skapa intuitiva PowerBI-instrumentpaneler som ger kunderna full insikt i deras kostnadslandskap.
Du är en problemlösare som arbetar bra med både tekniska och ekonomiska intressenter.  
* 

  

**Personliga egenskaper**

* Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en proaktiv inställning till problemlösning
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta, samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta självständigt
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill ständigt utveckla din kompetens

  
- **Vi erbjuder:**


	* Möjligheten att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö med spännande kunder och projekt
	* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom både teknik och karriär
	* En professionell miljö där kunskapsdelning och kontinuerligt lärande är en del av kulturen
	* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningarHos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens
  

dataplattformar, samtidigt som du arbetar nära innovativa projekt som skapar mätbara
  

resultat. Vi söker en person som är redo för nya utmaningar och som vill utvecklas vidare i en spännande och framtidsorienterad miljö.
  

**Är det här du? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

description:

You will be part of our cybersecurity group which is committed to building a strong security foundation across Vizrt. In your role as the senior cloud security engineer, you will have the opportunity and responsibility to shape Vizrt's cloud journey while making sure we are following the highest security standards in this area.
   





 What You'll Do{​{:}}
 


* Design, implement, and enhance cloud security controls across AWS and Azure.
* Identify and mitigate cloud security risks, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
* Integrate current security tooling and identify potential gaps in our cloud security controls.
* Collaborate with RnD teams to embed security best practices into cloud infrastructure.
* Lead incident response efforts related to cloud security threats and misconfigurations.
* Work with internal stakeholders to define and enforce security policies.
* Own and drive cloud security initiatives across AWS and Azure.
* Develop automation and security tooling to reduce manual effort to strengthen cloud security.
* Stay ahead of emerging cloud security threats and drive proactive risk mitigation strategie

* Experience with security automation, SIEM, and threat detection in cloud environments.

title: Associate Support Specialist
job_function: Customer Service, Information Technology, and Public Relations
description:
**Associate Support Specialist** 




**LOCATION: STOCKHOLM, SWEDEN** 




**FULL-TIME, PERMANENT** 




**HYBRID – 3 DAYS IN THE OFFICE** 




  





***Please submit your resume in English!***




  





 Notified is growing and we are hiring an Associate Support Specialist for the Client Service Delivery team in Stockholm.
 



 The Associate Support Specialist is responsible for database administration, account creation, and customer service within the Public Relations line of business. Your role will be to ensure customer service delivery in an accurate and timely manner while upholding security protocols.
 



 You will serve as a subject matter expert for Notified Public Relations Cloud products, providing day-to-day client advice and support. You will also promote the organization’s capabilities to clients and identify sales opportunities to be forwarded to the account managers in the Sales Department resulting in contract extensions or additional business within the account(s).
 



  





**Your Task Would Include** 



* providing day-to-day client advice, working to maintain strong client relationships
* communicating clearly with clients via phone, email, and chat
* responding to basic client support inquiries, ensuring they are handled in order of priority
* participating in analysis and resolution of unresolved support issues, escalating more complex issues to senior colleagues
* assisting in solving problems for clients, ensuring that SLAs and KPIs are met
* performing administrative duties including account and user maintenance outcomes using good interpersonal skills and organizational skills
* collaborating with teammates to work occasional overtime during high volume periods of other Notified service offerings



  





**What will you bring?** 



* Excellent Swedish & English speaking and writing skills
* Minimum of 1 year of experience in a client-facing position
* Previous newswire experience is preferred
* Customer service experience in a fast-paced environment
* Experience in support of complex products will be considered an advantage.
* Excellent multi-tasking skills
* Exceptional time-management skills, ability to prioritize assignments and meet deadlines
* Projects self-confidence, enthusiasm, and a positive, can-do attitude
* Tech savvy mindset and ability to learn new programs/software quickly



  





**Why Notified…** 




 We place a lot of value in giving our clients the solutions and support they need to operate efficiently and successfully. This same desire we use to set our customers up for success applies to our employees as well. Notified committed to helping our employees and their families maintain a healthy work/life balance, to build a financially secure future. Self-development and learning are key with all our global employees having access to our internal learning and development university DevelopU for career and skills enhancement.
 



  





**What Do We Offer:** 



* A diverse international work environment - global collaboration with team members in 17 countries!
* Comprehensive health benefits and wellness programs.
* Flexible work arrangements. This role will be based out of our Stockholm office, located at Vasagatan 28. Our expectation at this time is that you would work from the office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday with flexibility to work from home on Monday and Friday.
* Regular learning sessions, team-building events, and activities.
* Annual social events, including Summer and Christmas parties.
* A culture that celebrates innovation and creativity.
* Access to our virtual university, offering over 8,000 online courses.
* Quarterly Recognition Awards.
* A rewarding Referral Bonus Scheme.



  





**About NOTIFIED!** 




 We believe everyone has a story to tell and we’re passionate about helping people and brands amplify their stories across the globe. We are proud to be the number one provider of enterprise webcasting and investor relations content distribution, as well as a global leader in press release distribution. Our clients have used Notified to monitor over 2 billion social media conversations every year! Our products are built so storytellers can do their best work. But we’re not just a platform—personalized, caring service is how we operate. We add a personal touch to everything we do. We strive to deliver wisdom and insight by helping our clients reach global and targeted audiences, measure outcomes, and fulfill their commitments.
 



  





**Join the Best In Class!** 




 “Best Press Release Distribution Company,” MarTech Breakthrough Awards
 



 “PR Innovation of the Year,” Gold Stevie® Winner, 2023 American Business Awards
 



 “Marketing/Public Relations Solution,” Gold Stevie® Winner, 2023 American Business Awards
 



  





**What’s Next…** 




 Qualified candidates will be contacted by a member of our in-house recruitment team to kick-start the recruitment process. If you are a possible fit, you will be invited to meet with a few key individuals in order to help you get a full understanding of the team and the position. Our goal is for you to get to know us as we get to know you!
 



  





**Apply now to join our successful team!** 




  





**Please Note:** 




 Subject to local legislation, and as applicable to the position to which you have applied, Notified may require your consent at the point of offer to complete certain background screening checks including (but not limited to) Legal right to work in the relevant country, reference checks, Credit checks and Criminal checks. Failure to complete these checks / meet the required criteria may result in offer withdrawal.

title: Cloud Account Executive
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

**We’re Salesforce** 
 , the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+Data+CRM+Trust. Leading with our core values, we help the public sector blaze new trails and connect with citizens in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good– you’ve come to the right place.
 **Salesforce** 
 is looking for an outgoing
 **Account Executive - Public Sector** 
 with an entrepreneurial spirit. Think of yourself as an important client lead and facilitator in this role, selling the full Salesforce 360 platform to drive positive change for citizens.
   

  

 You will utilize the current and prospective new customers, act as a trusted digital advisor to understand their challenges and goals. You will collaborate with new customers on the Salesforce Platform to evangelize solutions that will help them reach their business goals, and blaze new trails within their organizations.
 **Support it there:** 
 You will work closely with peers and a highly skilled team of product specialists to help map out the best strategy for your customer and will have technical support from solutions architects and sales engineers.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
* Build and execute effective territory and account plans for the Public Sector in Denmark and Sweden to deliver sales objectives considering overall opportunities, customer business priorities, anticipated business changes, and our unique product capabilities and value proposition.
* Meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing sales opportunities within the assigned territory.
* Lead and leverage a matrix account team of Sales Consultants, Business Development Representatives, Services Practice Managers, Marketing, and Customer Success Professionals to develop and manage the sales pipeline and improve customer relationships and value.
* Manage re-sell partners, holding them accountable for delivering their expected sales and demand generation objectives.
* Manage and supervise customer and transactional information in a CRM system.
* Provide regular and accurate reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system.
* Nurture and expand the company’s relationship with customer accounts of various sizes and industries.
* Drive customer success by developing and maintaining a deep understanding of customers’ business and industry challenges, market competition, competitive issues, and products.
* Practice effective, excellent communication with leadership, customers, and extended team and partners.
* Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategic planning, sales training, customer marketing efforts, and customer care.
* Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.


**Knowledge And Skill Requirements**
* Sales carrying quota experience, with a proven track record of delivering results.
* Experience with selling Tableau or other data analytics solutions is an advantage. Experience with data, databases, predictive modeling, or business intelligence appreciated.
* Highly driven individual with a focus on execution, strong sense of urgency, and a belief in our Tableau mission.
* A mix of business curiosity combined with a technical ability to truly address customer data challenges and earn trust.
* Solution selling mindset: develop a plan and solution, articulate value, and navigate complexities of our customers to drive revenue.
* Demonstrable territory planning skills.
* Demonstrable experience working with senior decision-makers and stakeholders.
* Excellent communication skills and a highly collaborative working style.
* Adaptable, able to thrive in a fast-paced organization; reactive and open to new insights and challenges.
* Strong commercial acumen.
* Track record of delivering against sales targets.
* Fluency in English and Danish or Swedish is an advantage.
* Right to work in Denmark or Sweden.


**Day To Day**
* Engage with existing customers and new leads to sell the entire Tableau platform.
* Build positive, trusted relationships with key team members and C-suite decision-makers within the Public Sector.
* Drive the analytics discussion and identify use cases within your accounts.
* Develop opportunities through both warm leads and whitespace prospecting.
* Develop key customer stakeholder relationships and drive customer satisfaction at assigned accounts.
* Assist with the development and execution of overall long-term strategy for the account, aligned to customer business objectives.
* Coordinate internal resources including product support, customer success, and sales engineering to meet customer business needs.
* Assist with account planning at assigned accounts, coordinating with other sales resources to ensure strategic alignment.
* Manage complex sales-cycles and present to C-level executives the value proposition of the Tableau platform.
* Define and complete territory/account sales plans for the assigned territory and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing sales opportunities.
* Develop and manage the sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales, and move a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline.


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Microsoft 365 Specialist
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vi söker seniora Microsoft 365-specialister som vill skapa moderna, effektiva arbetsplatser för framtiden!**
 Har du minst fem års erfarenhet som specialist inom Microsoft 365 och vill ta nästa steg i en miljö där din kompetens verkligen gör skillnad? Nu söker vi fler seniora kollegor till vårt Modern Workplace-team som vill vara med och forma nästa generations digitala arbetsmiljöer tillsammans med oss på Sopra Steria.
   

  

**Mer om rollen**
 Som Microsoft 365-specialist hos oss arbetar du med att designa, utveckla och implementera strategiska lösningar baserade på Microsoft 365 och relaterade teknologier. Du blir en del av ett kunnigt, inkluderande och engagerat team som drivs av samarbete, nyfikenhet och viljan att skapa verklig nytta för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med spännande uppdrag där din erfarenhet, dina idéer och din tekniska höjd blir viktiga för att ta våra leveranser till nästa nivå.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet som specialist inom Microsoft 365 – du är trygg i din kompetens och van att guida kunder.
* Har arbetat med .NET, SharePoint, Microsoft 365, Power Platform och gärna även Azure.
* Har erfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server och Microsoft Graph API.
* Är van vid att arbeta i både svenska och internationella miljöer – du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
* Har ett starkt konsultmässigt mindset – du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och gillar att jobba nära kund.


 Det är meriterande om du tidigare arbetat i konsultroll och/eller har erfarenhet av arkitektur eller utveckling inom SharePoint eller Power Platform.
   

  

**Varför välja Sopra Steria?**
 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Microsofts ekosystem.
* Spännande uppdrag hos några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer.
* En kultur som bygger på Power of Sharing – vi lär oss av varandra, stöttar varandra och utvecklas tillsammans.
* Trygga villkor, förmåner och en arbetsmiljö där kompetens, balans och gemenskap står i centrum.


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, ett logiskt test, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Hör av dig till:
   

  

**Kalle Forsell** 
 , Talent Acquisition Partner: kalle.forsell@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Pu Fernqvist** 
 , Rekryterande chef: pu.fernqvist@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.**
**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We’re recruiting a Data Scientist for an ambitious FinTech company in Stockholm.
 



  





 You'll be working with a small, newly formed data science team that is solving complex challenges through the use of AI/ML for credit assessments and fraud detection. We’re looking for a Data Scientist with a passion for machine learning and applied AI to join them on this journey. This is not your typical analytics role, it's about solving real-world problems with AI, building and training ML models, and bringing them into production.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing:-** 



* Designing, developing, and deploying ML models
 
 to power intelligent features and automation across our product suite
* Working closely with engineers and product teams to turn business problems into ML/AI solutions
* Building and optimising training pipelines using frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Scikit-learn.
* Exploring data deeply to uncover patterns, drive hypothesis generation, and evaluate ML opportunities.



  





**Your Background:-** 



* 2+ years of experience working in data science, with a clear emphasis on machine learning or applied AI
* Proven experience building and deploying ML models in production environments
* Proficiency in Python and common ML/data libraries (e.g., NumPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow or PyTorch)
* Experience working with cloud platforms (GCP, AWS or Azure)
* Fluent English Speaker



  





**Bonus Points:-** 



* NLP, transformer models, or generative AI.
* Time-series forecasting or anomaly detection.
* Experience in MLOps tools and practices (e.g., MLflow, Docker, CI/CD, model monitoring)



  





**Why Join?** 



* Work on real AI applications that go beyond dashboards
* A flat, fast-paced team where your ideas go from prototype to production quickly
* Competitive salary and equity options

title: Solution Manager
description:
Do you have a strong technical background, passion for problem-solving and want to join and contribute to Trapets growth journey? Then this is the role for you! Our mission is to help businesses with the technology and knowledge needed to fight financial crime. We are now looking for a
 **Solution Manager** 
 to join our Stockholm team.
   

  

**About Trapets**
 Trapets is a market leader in providing cutting-edge RegTech SaaS solutions for the financial industry to prevent financial crime and to assure regulatory compliance. Trapets’ services simplify advanced monitoring of customers’ daily operations – from initial and ongoing customer screening to detecting money laundering, terror financing and fraud. Trapets also provides services for trading surveillance including detection of insider trading and market manipulation.
   

  

**About The Role At Trapets**
 You will work directly with our customers in large projects and offer consulting services including process and workflow review/development, implementation and deployment strategies, software training and technical guidance as well as industry expertise to ensure customers are maximising the value from their investment in Trapets technologies.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
* Drive successful projects from start to finish, while ensuring that any gaps are uncovered and to ensure best possible solution for our customers challenges.
* Ensure that the customer is setup correctly with Trapets systems and develop innovative ways of engaging and adding value to the customers business processes through Trapets Instantwatch platform and relevant services.
* Stay up to date on industry and regulatory trends as well as continuously enhance our processes to make them more efficient and adaptable to different solution needs.
* Create documentation such as internal guidelines, customized training material etc.


**Qualifications And Experience Required**
* Technical interest and experience of integration projects with API and complex data management.
* A consultative mindset with pedagogical skills in training and guidance of customers.
* Good financial markets knowledge ideally with some AML regulation experience.
* Excellent communication and presentation ability for a variety of stakeholders, as well as fluent English and Swedish language skills.
* Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills.


**What We Offer**
 Trapets company values
 *Engagement* 
 ,
 *Trust* 
 ,
 *Growth* 
 and
 *Together* 
 are our guiding stars to achieve our mission to help businesses with the technology and knowledge needed to fight financial crime. We offer:
   

  

  

* A hybrid workspace with a modern office in central Stockholm.
* 50% Remote work Policy.
* Frequent office breakfasts.
* A wellness allowance of 5 000 SEK per year.
* Private medical health care insurance.
* Pension plan.
* 30 days of holidays per year.
* Regular after-work events including off-site activities.
* The ability to truly impact and contribute to the growth of Trapets.
* Endless learning opportunities via supportive and talented colleagues.


**Interested?**
 If you believe you are the right candidate for this exciting career opportunity, please apply today.
   

  

 If you have questions and/or thoughts, contact Sara Bäckman by e-mail sara.backman@trapets.com
   

  

 For more information about Trapets: www.trapets.com
   

  

 Trapets is a software company that provides products and solutions for financial crime prevention, including anti-money laundering (AML), know your customer (KYC), and market surveillance. Founded in 2000 in Sweden, Trapets has grown to be one of the Nordic market leaders focusing solely on financial crime prevention through technology for decades.

title: Presales Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Retail
description:
Would you like to shape the future of retail with us? Become our next Presales Engineer in Stockholm!
 



  





 Are you a technically sharp and customer-focused individual who is passionate about smart solutions? At Fiftytwo, you will have the chance to play a key role in our continued expansion. We are a fast-growing, modern SaaS company in the Nordics that helps leading retailers like Kicks, BAUHAUS, and Preem create an outstanding in-store experience. Now we are looking for you who want to take the next step and become our Presales Engineer in Stockholm!
 



  





 In the role of Presales Engineer at Fiftytwo, you will become a central figure in our sales process. You will work closely with our sales, product, and implementation teams to understand customers unique needs and translate them into tailored solutions based on our innovative POS platform. Your ability to communicate technical advantages in a business-oriented way will be crucial for building trust and creating long-term customer relationships.
 



  





 This is an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge retail technology that's already being used by top Nordic brands. We offer a modern, collaborative, and flat organizational culture where your contributions are valued. Enjoy flexibility with our hybrid work model, and look forward to our planned office opening in Stockholm in 2026, which will even include a showroom. You’ll be joining two colleagues already based in Stockholm, making it easier to collaborate locally. This is your chance to be part of a high-impact, commercial-facing role within a company that's currently in an exciting scale-up phase. The headquarters is in Copenhagen.
 



  





 In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Randstad. Do you have any questions about the position or the process? Please contact recruitment consultant Hanna Wide at hanna.wide@randstad.se. We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Collaborate with account executives to qualify opportunities and define customer needs.
* Deliver tailored product demos and technical presentations to key stakeholders.
* Translate customer pain points into solution architectures using our POS platform.
* Respond to RFPs/RFIs and provide input on functional and technical documentation.
* Guide customers through proof-of-concept and pilot setups, coordinating with product as needed.
* Act as the technical voice in customer meetings, ensuring feasibility and alignment with best practices.
* Support the handover to the implementation team after deal closure.
* Stay up to date with product updates, integrations, retail trends, and competitive positioning.
* Occasionally represent the company at events, webinars, or partner sessions.
* Improve sales processes and operation for optimal customer buying process and onboarding
* Improve team performance by ensuring clear customer expectations and showcasing the best solutions.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* 3+ years in a presales, solution engineering, technical consulting, or similar role.
* Experience with POS software, retail tech, or SaaS platforms is a strong plus.
* Ability to challenge customers on user journeys in retail environments including store processes.
* Strong understanding of modern retail operations (unified commerce, mobile POS, SCO, loyalty, inventory, etc.).
* Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Hands-on mindset – comfortable setting up demo environments and digging into APIs or integrations.
* Fluent in Swedish (native) and English (written and spoken).
* Based in or around Stockholm; some travel within Sweden and the Nordics expected.



  





**Fiftytwo** 




  





 At Fiftytwo, we specialize in creating software solutions that enhance customer experiences and
 



 boost sales in retail. With decades of industry expertise, we offer advanced point-of-sale (POS)
 



 software and innovative technology for unattended stores. Our solutions help clients stay
 



 competitive by improving operational efficiency and delivering exceptional service.

title: Analytics Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Bli en nyckelspelare i framtidens dataanalys på Sopra Steria!**
 Vill du arbeta på spännande konsultuppdrag där du får möjligheten att forma datadrivna lösningar och visualisera insikter i moderna BI-verktyg? Vi söker flera
 **Analytics Engineers** 
 som brinner för att tillgängliggöra data för verksamheten genom analys, visualisering och strategisk rådgivning. Har du några års erfarenhet och vill fortsätta utvecklas, eller är du en senior profil som letar efter nästa stora utmaning? Vi letar efter dig!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Uppdrag hos ledande företag och organisationer, där du arbetar med modern dataanalys och BI-utveckling i Power BI och Azure.
* Möjlighet att påverka hela analyskedjan – från datainsamling och modellering till visualisering och beslutsstöd.
* En roll där du får driva arbetet hos kunder och vara en nyckelspelare i tvärfunktionella team.
* En kultur där vi delar kunskap, utvecklar varandra och håller oss i framkant av tekniken.


**Som Analytics Engineer kommer du att:**
* Utveckla rapporter och visualiseringar i Power BI och andra BI-verktyg.
* Arbeta med datamodellering och transformationer i Azure-miljöer.
* Bidra till att migrera on-premise-lösningar till molnet.
* Samarbeta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från idé och kravställning till utveckling, testning och förvaltning.
* Utveckla skalerbara och framtidssäkra datalösningar som stödjer affärsbeslut.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker både
 **juniora och seniora profiler** 
 , där erfarenhetsnivån avgör vilka arbetsuppgifter och ansvar du får.
   

  

**Junior profil:**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av analys, BI-utveckling eller liknande roller.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga rapporter i Power BI eller andra BI-verktyg.
* Grundläggande förståelse för SQL och databashantering.


**Senior profil:**
* Minst 5–7 års erfarenhet inom dataanalys, BI eller data engineering.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av datamodellering, ETL-processer och cloud-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda projekt och coacha kollegor.


**Tekniska färdigheter:**
* Power BI (krav) – erfarenhet av olika typer av installationer.
* Azure, SQL, databashantering och datamodellering.
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av Qlik, Tableau, Data Engineering, AI och Data Science.


**Varför välja oss?**
 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan arbeta flexibelt, utvecklas inom
 **teknik och innovation** 
 och ingå i ett team av
 **kompetenta och engagerade kollegor** 
 . Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med
 **spännande uppdrag hos några av Sveriges ledande företag** 
 och bidra till att skapa
 **framtidens Business Intelligence-lösningar** 
 .
   

  

 Bli en del av Sopra Steria! 🚀
   

  

**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, ett logiskt test, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Service Owner
description:
**Join our Team**
**Job Title: Service Owner**
 Within BCSS CNE SPS, Shared Verification Cloud, we are looking for a senior leader who will be able to take the role of “Service Owner” for parts of our services. As the
 **Service Owner** 
 of the service you will be responsible for the governance of the life cycle management of the service across sites on a global level, that includes the
 **service design** 
 to secure Service descriptions, SLA, Deployment and measurements also to provide prioritization input to the Service Development backlog of the service offerings within the scope of the Service. As the Service owner you will be responsible for aligning and merging the development backlogs of each service offering within your responsibility area in close collaboration with Product Owners.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* LCM (Life cycle management) responsible in PPM
* The service being properly defined and described in SPS Service Registry
* Responsible for IT assets (e.g, Hardware, instances, Software) the service generates, if there are any
* Secure adherence to BCSS Development Environment Service Framework
* Responsible to fulfill applicable security and architecture requirements (Compliance)
* Business Continuity management responsible for the service
* making sure the service is appropriately staffed and funded
* Establishing / contribute to the service roadmap (if required)
* Ensure stakeholders and users of the services understand what the service is, does and how it is ordered
* Act on issues in the service dependency’s (e.g dependency to a SAN, PLM , E-IT delivered service)
* Ensure that measurements and reporting of service quality and performance is possible
* Set and follow KPIs to track Service performance


**You will bring**
* Excellent leadership experience
* Deep understanding of the R&D flow as well as of Lean and Agile methodology
* Deep understanding on how to perform efficient Development and Operations including continuous design, integration, deployment and operations
* Overall technical knowledge of Cloud Native Software Development
* Technical knowledge of Ericsson Cloud products and BCSS products
* Experience working with budgeting and financials
* The capability to formulate strategies for a highly efficient development environment as well as software pipelines
* The ability to work closely with Programs, PDUs, Engineering Services, IT and other Ericsson partners
* The ability to break down barriers to support a speedy execution in a high pace environment
* Ability to lead teams into new ways of working and have a track record of setting and delivering to high standards
* Thrive in a constantly evolving and complex environment
* MSc level in a technical field or the equivalent level of knowledge
* Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 764255

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
I have a new role for a Data Engineer to join a global leader in the digital transformation of the building and construction industry, offering innovative solutions to connect stakeholders and streamline workflows.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and infrastructure. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accessibility, quality, and security. This is Full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm and this is a hybrid position
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure efficient data flow and transformation.
* Build and optimize data storage and retrieval solutions, such as data warehouses and lakes.
* Work closely with data analysts and data scientists to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data workflows to ensure reliability and performance.
* Implement best practices for data governance, security, and compliance.
* Document data processes and maintain technical documentation.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of professional experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Proficient in dbt
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Hands-on experience with data tools and platforms, including SQL, Apache Spark, or similar.
* Knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
* Fluent in Swedish (required) and proficient in English.



  





 This is a great opportunity to join a global company at the forefront of digital transformation, allowing you to work with cutting-edge technology.

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Data Infrastructure team at Visa Global Open Banking provides the infrastructure, tools, and pipelines needed to support our organization’s data-driven applications. Our mission is to ensure that data is collected, transformed, and presented in a secure, timely, reliable, and cost-efficient manner.
   

  





 Key Responsibilities:
   

  




* Design, build, and maintain large-scale, cloud-based data services.
* Develop and maintain automated CI/CD pipelines and processes.
* Monitor and ensure the reliability and performance of the data infrastructure.
* Implement and enforce best practices for data security and compliance.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to support production systems.



 If you are a talented and passionate Data Infrastructure Engineer looking for a new challenge, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team in central Stockholm!
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* 3+ years of engineering experience.
* Proven success in designing, building, and managing large-scale, cloud-based services.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Hands-on experience in an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) environment (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation).
* Proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Go, or Python.
* Experience with data warehouse tools (e.g., dbt, Apache Airflow).
* Strong understanding and experience with Cloud Security best practices.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Chief Architect - Vehicle Architecture
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 At Scania’s Vehicle Architecture section, we work at the heart of early-phase product development—designing modular truck architecture and layout that support multiple brands while enabling innovation, performance, and flexibility.
   

  

 Our group focuses on architectural investigations, strategic concept development and layout & package studies, collaborating across Scania, MAN, and other TRATON brands. We are a team of 16 skilled layout engineers and architects, working in three collaborative sub-teams. We value different experiences and perspectives—because we believe they lead to stronger, more effective solutions.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will be one of the key players creating and maintaining a complete vehicle architectural strategy for our VCT Vehicle Architecture. You will contribute to our architectural roadmap work for our common TMS to ensure a complete vehicle composition over time.
   

  

 Among others, you will be:
   

  

  

* Leading cross functional architectural and layout investigations as well as property trade-offs on a complete vehicle level
* Conducting technical dependency studies of project initiatives in an early phase (blue/yellow arrow) and identify new focus groups for VA
* Conducting Architecture trade-off analysis
* Supporting to visualize how the main interfaces are managed over time
* Aligning and harmonizing architectural recommendations together with other VCT System Architects and VCF Solution Architects
* Supporting our cross VCF Architecture Working Group


 In your daily work, you will work closely with our other Vehicle Architecture Chief Architects and Layout Engineers in your domain. The global network with our brands, VCTs and VCFs is also part of your daily collaboration.
   

  

 This role offers the chance to collaborate with different brands and departments, bridging design, engineering, and innovation. You will play a vital part in translating business needs and technical requirements into smart, scalable design concepts.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced analytical thinker with a passion for modularity. You thrive on collaboration, but you’re also confident working independently and taking initiative. You enjoy working at the intersection of concept, design, and systems thinking, with the ability to both zoom out and focus on technical details.
   

  

 We believe you’ll succeed if you bring:
   

  

  

* A university degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s) in mechanical, automotive or system engineering
* High Level of Technical Leadership Experience with previous experience as Senior Designer / Architect
* Deep knowledge of the modular system as a concept
* Previous work experience in the automotive industry or a relevant cross-functional environment
* Experience working with Visio, Matlab and Catia V5
* Excellent communication skills in English; Swedish is a plus
* A proactive mindset, with the ability to plan and organize your own and others’ deliveries


**TRATON Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-30. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: julian.erlemeier@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: SVT söker CTO/Teknikdirektör
description:
SVT är Sveriges största och mest mångfacetterade medieföretag med ett uppdrag som inte liknar något annat. SVT verkar i allmänhetens tjänst och drivs självständigt i förhållande till politiska, kommersiella och andra intressen i samhället. Målsättningen att erbjuda ett engagerande, underhållande och berikande utbud för alla åldrar och intressen. SVT är ett ledande public service-företag i Europa med ett omfattande internationellt nätverk.
   

  

 SVT har en stark närvaro över hela Sverige med programredaktioner i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Umeå samt 50 lokala nyhetsredaktioner. Företaget har cirka 2100 medarbetare, varav drygt hälften arbetar på huvudkontoret i Stockholm, och producerar ett brett utbud som sträcker sig från nyheter till barn- och ungdomsprogram, underhållning, drama, film, sport, livsstil, kultur, fakta, samhällsprogram, dokumentärer och minoritetsutbud.
   

  

 SVT:s vision är att bidra till ett Sverige där alla är mer nyfikna och insatta. De övergripande strategiska målen är att skapa värde både för samhället och för individen genom att stärka SVT som hela Sveriges samlingsplats för kunskap och gemenskap, att öka takten i övergången till online-plattformar, samt att arbeta tillsammans mer effektivt och hållbart.
   

  

**Vad gör SVT?**
 Åtta av tio svenskar tittar på SVT:s utbud varje vecka. De flesta tar del av SVT både via TV-kanalerna och de digitala tjänsterna, SVT Play och SVT Nyheter, och väljer det sätt att titta som passar dem bäst. Via SVT:s fem TV-kanaler sänds varje år cirka 23 000 timmar. SVT1 är Sveriges största TV-kanal.
   

  

 SVT:s digitala tjänster växer stadigt och speglar den snabba tekniska utvecklingen och förändringen av medievanorna. SVT Play är både Sveriges största streamingtjänst och den tjänst som har högst förtroende. Den största ökningen i digitalt tittande sker i dag via mobilen och genom att SVT Play kopplas upp på den stora TV-skärmen i hemmen. Under det senaste året har antalet unika besökare på SVT Play ökat med 10 procent jämfört med föregående år. SVT:s nyhetstjänst är en omfattande och pålitlig källa för nyheter och information till hela svenska befolkningen och är internationellt ledande på att utveckla digital nyhetsvideo.
   

  

 SVT är till för alla och alla ska kunna ta till sig av SVT:s utbud. I uppdraget ingår till exempel att göra utbud på de nationella minoritetsspråken samt för personer med funktionsnedsättning med hjälp av olika tillgänglighetstjänster.
   

  

**Befattningen**
 SVT står inför stora förändringar. Publiken flyttar sig från tablålagd tv till SVT:s digitala tjänster, AI och ny teknik förändrar tv-produktionen och vi måste förhålla oss till en orolig omvärld.
   

  

**Som CTO/teknikdirektör Är Du**
* Övergripande chef för cirka 650 medarbetare som är experter inom en rad områden: supporttekniker, mediatekniker, textare/översättare, fotografer, redigerare, ljudtekniker, sminköser, snickare, undertextare, grafiker, tekniska projektledare och producenter, produktionservicetekniker, IT-säkerhetsspecialister och digitala utvecklare.
* Ansvarig för verksamhet och medarbetare på fyra orter (Stockholm, Malmö, Göteborg, Umeå) och driften av tekniken på SVT:s alla 50 kontor i hela Sverige, samt ansvarar för avdelningarna språk & tillgänglighet och Magasin 4 (som är SVT:s kostym, rekvisita- och möbelsamlingar).
* Övergripande ansvarig för SVT:s IT-säkerhet samt SVT:s investeringsbudget, liksom för våra interna och externa verktyg, licenser, molnlösningar och elsäkerhet.


**Fokusområden För Rollen Framåt Är**
* I samråd med bland annat SVT:s mediedirektör ansvarar du för att ta nästa steg i att förnya och förhoppningsvis förenkla SVT:s tekniska infrastruktur samt att strukturera SVT:s rika och varierade data så att vi ska kunna ta nästa steg i att implementera AI-verktyg samt jobba datainformerat på kloka och effektiva sätt.
* Att fortsätta resan att modernisera SVT:s sätt att producera utbud och att underlätta rörelsen från tung, kostsam hårdvara till enklare och billigare mjukvara. SVT ligger långt fram i internationella jämförelser och vi vill fortsatt ha en ledande roll.
* I SVT:s nästa sändningstillstånd föreslås SVT få ett teknikneutralt uppdrag. Här ansvarar du för att, tillsammans med företagets experter, hitta kostnadseffektiva lösningar som medför att SVT:s digitala interna och publika tjänster blir än mer redundanta och säkra. SVT är en del av totalförsvaret och den tekniska utvecklingen måste drivas i samklang med SVT:s beredskapsuppdrag. I höjd beredskap ska SVT sända så mycket som möjligt, så länge som möjligt.


 Som person är du nyfiken på AI:s potential (och risker), du är gärna ingenjör och har god förståelse för tekniska samband och vikten av data. Du behöver inte vara expert på den traditionella broadcast-tekniken men vi förväntar oss att du lär dig förstå grunderna för att kunna bidra till utvecklingen.
   

  

**Kravprofil**
 Bakgrund och erfarenheter:
   

  

* Erfaren och omvittnad god ledare av teknik och innovation inom en användarcentrerad organisation.
* Djup förståelse för AI och dess framtida påverkan på journalistik, teknik och produktion.
* God förmåga till omvärldsanalys och att tillämpa data i beslutsfattande.
* Erfarenhet av IT- och informationssäkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av att leda förändring av såväl verksamhet som organisation.
* Erfarenhet av budget- och/eller resultatansvar.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa och bygga relationer internt och externt samt leverantörsstyrning.


**Personliga Egenskaper**
* Visionärt tänkande med en balans av praktiskt fokus på verkligheten.
* Utåtriktad, lyhörd, lyssnande och inspirerande och med mycket god kommunikativ förmåga.
* Skicklig organisatör med dokumenterad strategisk förmåga.
* God samarbetsförmåga och erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella projekt.
* Adaptivt tänkande i en komplex värld där tekniken utvecklas rasande fort.


**Annat Som Är Bra Att Veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med start enligt överenskommelse. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Novare. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Charlotta Skogar (charlotta.skogar@novare.se) på Novare. Fackliga frågor besvaras av Maria Fornemo, Unionen, Rebecka Mårtensson SJF, Fanny Lindhé, SACO eller Johan Lindén (Ledarna) samtliga nås på telefon 08-784 00 00 (vxl).
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Lösningsansvarig ekonomisystem
description:
Det här är rollen för dig som vill arbeta i en nyckelroll som förenar IT och ekonomi och därigenom skapar värde för hela organisationen.
 



  





 För dig som är ny för oss är vi ett fastighetsbolag- faktiskt Sveriges ledande. Och frågar du våra nya kollegor säger i princip alla samma sak. Det är lätt att börja på Vasakronan för vi är vänliga, tar oss tid och är extremt bjussiga med vår kunskap. Här kan du förvänta dig att bli del av en kultur som är öppen, vänlig och inkluderande. Att Vasakronans avkastning går till det allmänna pensionssystemet, och att du på så sätt bidrar till dagens och morgondagens pensioner hoppas vi också att du ser som ett stort plus. Läs gärna mer om Vasakronan
 **här.** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Lösningsansvarig ekonomisystem är du beställaransvarig för Vasakronans IT-stöd inom ekonomi. Detta omfattar system som Unit4 och Vitec samt ett flertal andra lösningar. Du säkerställer att systemen möter verksamhetens behov, fungerar effektivt och utvecklas i linje med Vasakronans strategiska mål.
 



  





 Rollen innebär nära samarbete med kollegor inom IT, ekonomi och controlling samt leverantörer. Du driver kravställning, testning och uppföljning och ansvarar för förvaltnings- och utvecklingsplanering. Dessutom arbetar du strategiskt för att vidareutveckla IT-stödet och säkerställa en kostnadseffektiv leverans.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av Vasakronans IT-lösningar inom ekonomi.
* Samordna krav och behov, översätta dessa till lösningar och agera beställare mot leverantörer.
* Planera och följa upp förvaltnings- och utvecklingsarbete, inklusive budget och kostnadsuppföljning.
* Driva strategisk utveckling och kontinuerlig förbättring av IT-stöd inom ekonomi.
* Delta i upphandlingar och hantera behörighetsadministration.



  





 Du rapporterar till Vasakronans IT-chef och utgår från vårt supermoderna och fina huvudkontor i Sergelhusen, mitt i Stockholm City.
 



  





**Utveckla och utvecklas med oss** 




 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en beställarroll inom IT, med fokus på ekonomisystem. Du har även vana av att leda förvaltnings- och utvecklingsarbete, där du säkerställer att tekniska lösningar effektivt möter verksamhetens behov.
 



 För bästa förutsättningar för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
 


* Akademisk utbildning inom IT (systemvetare, ingenjör eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-stöd inom ekonomi eller ERP-system.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltningsledning och/eller utvecklingsledning.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av upphandlingar och kravställning inom IT-lösningar.



  





 Meriterande är erfarenhet från fastighetsbranschen.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är lösningsorienterad, strukturerad, analytisk och ser helheten utan att tappa fokus på detaljer. Viktigt är också att du är kommunikativ, initiativtagande och trivs med att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt. Du är även van vid att driva projekt framåt och tar ett stort ansvar för att skapa effektiva och användarvänliga lösningar. Då du kommer ha många kontaktytor internt och externt är det slutligen viktigt att du är en skicklig relationsskapare och inte bara gillar att samarbeta och dela kunskap, utan har en vilja att göra det – på absolut bästa sätt.
 



  





 Självklart kommer vi göra allt för att du ska lyckas, och här på Vasakronan finns alla möjligheter för ett hållbart arbetsliv och att driva din egen utveckling. Via vår kultur, olika utbildningar men framför allt genom att delta i eller leda spännande projekt tillsammans med våra engagerade och kompetenta kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sina erfarenheter. Här är det du som sätter gränser för din utveckling!
 



  





**Välkommen till Vasakronan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Boxhill Rekrytering. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. Vill du veta mer, kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryterare Petra Törnblom på petra.tornblom@bhill.se.

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**
* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products with a focus on online prediction.
* Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems.
* Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment.
* Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Required:
   

  

 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
   

  

 Comfortable work with multi-cloud setup and experience with AWS or/and GCP and containerized environment like Kubernetes.
   

  

 Solid understanding of machine learning lifecycle and fundamentals.
   

  

 Expertise in Python.
   

  

 Familiarity with Terraform, GitHub and GitHub Actions.
   

  

 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
   

  

  

  

 Bonus Qualifications:
   

  

 Experience with Vertex AI, specifically in online prediction.
   

  

 Experience with Cloud Run and Workload Identity Federation.
   

  

 Experience with kubeflow pipelines
   

  

 Experience with Triton inference server and TensorRT
   

  

 Understanding of data security and privacy regulations.
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
**Build trust. Grow business. Help Nordic companies break free from hyperscaler dependency!** 




  





 Safespring isn’t your typical cloud provider. We’re not chasing hyperscale. We’re not locking anyone in. We’re building something different - a European alternative for organizations who care about
 **security, privacy, and independence** 
 .
 



  





 And behind that mission? Real people who care about their craft, their customers, and each other.
 



  





 For years, we’ve been the trusted cloud partner for universities, research centres and healthcare providers across Sweden and Norway. But now?
 



  





**We’re ready for our next chapter. We're entering the Enterprise market and expanding our business in the SaaS market. On purpose. On our terms.** 




  





 This is where
 **you** 
 come in!
 



  





 We’re looking for a relationship driven
 **Senior Account Manager** 
 who can help us break new ground. Someone who’s as passionate about relationships as they are about results. Someone who understands that real sales isn’t just about “closing” - it’s about building trust - and playing the long-term game. Sounds like you?
 



  





**What will you do?** 




  




* You’ll grow and develop existing customer relationships - helping them get more value from Safespring.
* You’ll open doors with SaaS companies and enterprise customers - building trust long before a contract lands on the table.
* And after it lands on the table, you’ll still be there, because that’s when the real work starts.



  





**What kind of person thrives here?** 




  




* You are tech-savvy enough to hold your own conversations about things like Kubernetes and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS). You can break down complex ideas, understanding what the customer really needs, and turning that into smart solution suggestions.
* You like solving real problems for real people - not just selling for the sake of it.
* You understand the Enterprise and SaaS world - their hopes, fears, buying cycles and budget battles.
* You understand and enjoy technical sales - but you're not afraid to say
 *"I don't know, but I’ll find out."*
* You have a deep understanding of the current market, and curiosity about technologies in general.



  





**Your Team** 




  





 We are a small diverse team of 25 colleagues who believe in transparency, open source technology, sustainability and data sovereignty. You will join Sales Team that currently consists of Fredric, our founder, Daniel, our business and strategy developer, and Petter, our commercial manager.
 



  





**What’s unique in our tech set-up?** 




  





 We are proud to say we are at the European forefront of providing highly-available services such as compute, storage, backup, and container platform, built with open-source. We use Linux, CEPH for storage and OpenStack for orchestration.
 



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




  




* A key role in shaping Safespring’s next phase of growth
* Impact - we are small enough that your daily work will make a visible impact on whole company, and big enough that you feel supported in your role
* Room to do things your way
* Smart, kind, technical colleagues who care deeply about what they do
* Customers who want partners
* A flexible and hybrid work environment
* Stability of a collective bargaining agreement
* Market salary & commission on sales



  





 This is a hybrid role with our office in Solna, Stockholm. Our Sales Team meets in person at least twice a week.
 



  





**Questions?** 




 Send a message to Marietta, our People and Culture Lead, at marietta@safespring.com
 



  





**Ready to make a difference? We are looking forward to getting to know you!**

title: Cyber Security Specialist till DeLaval, Tumba
description:
Vill du arbeta i ett innovativt företag där du kan bidra till en mer hållbar värld? DeLaval är världsledande inom mjölkningsindustrin. Vi levererar integrerade lösningar för mjölkproduktion utformade för att förbättra produktion, djurhälsa och den övergripande livskvaliteten för mjölkproducenter. Vi utvecklar, tillverkar och marknadsför utrustning och kompletta system för mjölkproduktion och djurhållning världen över. DeLaval levererar även service och ett brett utbud av tillbehör. Vi tillhandahåller effektiva system för mjölkning, driftsledning, kyla, utfodring, utgödsling, ventilation och energiåtervinning.
   

  

 DeLaval grundades för mer än 140 år sedan av visionären Gustaf de Laval som patenterade mjölkseparatorn. Idag har DeLaval 4 500 medarbetare och finns representerat i mer än 100 länder. DeLaval, tillsammans med Tetra Pak och Sidel, är en del av Tetra Lavalgruppen.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Cyber Security Specialist kommer du ingå i DeLavals Information Security Team (DLIST) som tillhör IT-avdelningen. Gruppen ansvarar för informationssäkerhet och cybersäkerhet inom hela DeLaval Group och arbetar under styrning av Governance som arbetar tvärfunktionellt inom hela koncernen. I rollen agerar du som businesspartner gentemot verksamheten och är ett viktigt verksamhetsstöd. Då arbetet idag sker till stor del i en outsourad miljö innebär ditt arbete styrning och kravställning mot våra partners.
   

  

 I resan, tillsammans med IT-avdelningen, kommer en digitaliseringsutveckling att ske med fokus på att gå mot Cloud. Framåt vill vi bli mer flexibla och mobila med ambitionen att bli än mer globala, snabbfotade och digitala. Vi går också en spännande framtid till mötes när vi ska byta ut flertalet av våra säkerhetssystem och säkerhetspartners (SOC/MDR). DeLaval IT har som mål att gå mot en mer centraliserad, strukturerad och flexibel arbetsmiljö genom att ta tillbaka utvalda delar av den outsourcade kompetensen inhouse: processer, strukturer i arbetssätt, verktyg, system och spetskompetens står i fokus. Detta kommer i sin tur att ställa nya krav på hur vi behöver jobba för att möta föränderliga cyberhot mot verksamheten.
   

  

**Några av dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden i rollen är att:**
* Arbeta proaktivt med att säkerställa att rätt säkerhetskrav definieras och implementeras baserat på identifierade risker
* Granska, analysera och förbättra befintliga säkerhetssystem och vara drivande i att integrera säkerhetsperspektivet i olika projekt
* Aktivt deltaga i val och införande av nya säkerhetssystem
* Ställa krav på och samarbeta med systemleverantörer för optimal systemkonfiguration utifrån ett säkerhetsperspektiv
* Jobba utifrån DeLavals ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet (LIS) och förbättra policys, procedurer och standarder för säkerhet på koncernnivå
* Hantera och förebygga säkerhetsincidenter i nära samarbete med säkerhetsavdelningar inom Tetra Laval Group
* Genomföra säkerhetsgranskningar och arbeta med Vulnerability Management, inklusive sårbarhetsscanningar och uppföljning av åtgärder
* Förbättra nätverkssäkerheten genom nätverkssegmentering och skapa High Level Security Design
* Delta i utvecklingen av DeLavals Cyber Security Awareness program
* Utarbeta Security Incident Response Playbooks
* Hela tiden jobba riskbaserat och med verksamhetens bästa i åtanke. DeLaval Information Security team (DLIST) ska agera som en möjliggörare


 Tjänsten är baserad på DeLavals huvudkontor i vår idylliska omgivning i Tumba, söder om Stockholm. Arbetet utförs delvis på distans men majoriteten av din arbetstid utförs på kontoret.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi söker en person med minst sex års erfarenhet inom Cyber Security. Du bör ha en relevant utbildning inom IT-säkerhet samt erfarenhet av Cloud Security, Endpoint Security och nätverkssäkerhet. Certifieringar som CISSP eller GIAC är också viktiga. Vi värdesätter en god teknisk förståelse, erfarenhet av att arbeta med leverantörer och vana att ställa krav på säkerhet. Det är också viktigt att du har erfarenhet av sårbarhetsanalyser, sårbarhetsskanningar och hantering av säkerhetsincidenter i en komplex IT-miljö.
